meanings.definition: An opening in a wall or roof that is fitted with glass or other transparent material to admit light and allow people to see out.
meanings.sent1: The sunlight streamed through the windows, brightening the room.
meanings.sent2: She gazed out of the windows, watching the birds fly by.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to catch the sunlight reflections in the windows.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like windows to her soul, revealing her true emotions.
meanings.sent5: The broken windows whispered stories of the past inhabitants.

meanings.definition: An opening in a computer screen that allows the user to view different parts of a document or different documents.
meanings.sent1: He resized the windows on his computer to compare the data easily.
meanings.sent2: Multiple windows were open on her screen, each displaying a different webpage.
meanings.sent3: The pop-up windows kept appearing, making it hard to focus on work.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt cluttered, like having too many windows open at once.
meanings.sent5: The windows on his screen provided a glimpse into various virtual worlds.
